results.title: Overcoming resistance to change
results.creator_credit: Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Productions
results.brief_description: Explains emotional factors causing resistance to new methods in industry, and shows how supervisors can deal with problems of this kind by developing participation and discussion of problems and reducing hostility.

results.title: Over to you
results.brief_description: This film describes a less familiar application of Marshall Aid - visits to America by teams from many countries to study productivity. In Britain such teams are organised by the Anglo-Amnerican Productivity Council which, in 1950, assembled the team from Britain’s hosiery industry and trade unions, whose tour of the United States, followed by the preparation of its report, is here recorded.

results.title: Over the Andes in Ecuador
results.creator_credit: Institut für Film und Bild and Public Media
results.brief_description: The major difficulties restricting Ecuador’s development are illustrated by the journey of a crate to a tiny village in the Amazon Basin. Also shows the standard of living, and the differences between the cities of Guayaquil and Quito. (Edited version of an Institut fur Film und Bild, Munich film.)

results.title: Over in the meadow
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: For generations children have sung and loved this gay, counting song in which flowers, animals and birds, mothers and babies have provided the delightful setting for a lesson in numbers and nature. In this version lively vignettes in stunning colours make ideal company for the rhythmic pattern of the text.

results.title: Over-the-counter drugs: smooth talk & small print (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Larry Stein, Barr Films and Vision Films
results.brief_description: Analyses the claims and promises of TV commercials for non-prescription drugs. It points out that the small print on product labels contains information about ingredients and dosages as well as warnings about adverse reactions that could occur. Stresses the danger of mixing drugs and drinking alcohol while taking drugs. Encourages people to talk to their pharmacist.

results.title: Outward bound to adventure
results.brief_description: The Outward Bound School in Malaya. Boys aged between 15 and 25 years are given valuable character training through planned outdoor activities which call primarily for physical fitness, self-reliance, initiative and teamwork. The film shows how Kim Seng, a young Malayan factory worker, benefits from a course at the school.

group_siblings.title: Outward bound girls' scheme
group_siblings.creator_credit: Bill Latto, Scheppes and Town and Country Productions

results.title: Outward bound girls' scheme
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto, Scheppes and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “New Horizons”.
The aims and activities of the ‘Outward Bound’ girls’ residential course at Rhewniar in the rugged country of mid-west Wales. Shows the arrival of a new course and the girls being introduced to the accommodation and facilities. Includes fitness training, tuition in camp craft, canoe construction, rope work, home nursing, drama and self expression. The girls are seen accepting the ever increasing challenge of mountains, rivers and open waters in progressive expeditions. Photographed by Alan Masters, edited by Stella Smallwood, music by Denis Moonan, commentary by Richard Baker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Latto, Scheppes and Town and Country Productions

results.title: Outward bound
results.brief_description: This film follows a group of six young men on the 99th Outward Bound Course. The dialogue conveys their thoughts and feelings as they take part in rock-climbing, canoeing, caving, cross-country running, and camping. Shows the different reactions of the group to the challenge of survival in these conditions. Suitable for upper secondary level.
